ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm
ygData.msgSnippet: There is definitely a positive aspect to it - this is a really nice feature for people who can really use it.  It s just too bad that there s no doubt it will
ygData.messageBody:
There is definitely a positive aspect to it - this is a really nice feature
for people who can really use it. It's just too bad that there's no doubt
it will be abused.

I do think it's good that they are stripping items and cash on a server
move - it could cause a serious problem on a newer server (especially if a
large group moves) and more importantly - will prevent "K3w1 d00dz") from
moving without impunity to another server where their bad rep won't follow
them).

Also, I personally I think the rates are a tad high - $300 - (3 or move
cross server) is not an insignificant amount of money...


-----Original Message-----
From: Randy Keith [mailto:Kalekona@...]
Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 4:36 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm


Well, here's the other perspective.

I play EQ. My GF saw, wondered why I was on the game for hours, and now
plays EQ as well.

We have two computers, (Now), and I would be REALLY glad to get her off
mine. I even already bought her
new accounts that I would PL her on. Now I don't have to PL her at all, she
can just get transferred.

Personally, I think $50 is no big deal to be able to get my account all to
myself and not have to share
computer time on EQ...

Daniel Sniderman wrote:

> If that was a "problem" there would be no selling or e-baying. All
accounts
> sold this way require the account to have previously been established with
> the original account owners credit card.
>
> You'll split the chars off to a new account and then sell it.
>
> Long term - this isn't necessarily an e-bay issue - but short term it's a
> huge one. Every person with a reasonably (to very) high level character
> they don't use any more will be tempted to split them off and sell them.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nygaardr, FC3 [mailto:nygaardr@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 4:23 PM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] all i can say is hmmmm
>
> "This should be rather interesting. Power level a char up on a secondary
> account, transfer to a friend that is too slow leveling or something..."
>
> Cant transfer between accounts that are owned by different people (IE
> different billing info including credit card.
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cyr, Thierry [mailto:thierry.cyr@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 10:09 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [eqbards] all i can say is hmmmm
>
> https://store.station.sony.com/eq_char_moves/index.jsp
>
> This should be rather interesting. Powerlevel a char up on a secondary
> account, transfer to a friend that is too slow leveling or something...
> Wonder how big an impact this will be to the community. Hmm have a friend
> who quit and doesnt have the heart to start over, no problem, transfer him
> one of your old characters...
>
> 'nuff said
>
> Minkin
> RIP
> A Ro
